api_call:
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://management.azure.comundefined/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/operations?api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE'
api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Lists all the available REST API operations.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

instruction_candidates.candidate: How do I retrieve a list of all available REST API operations using Azure ML Web Services Management Client?
instruction_candidates.input_text:
Functionality: 
Description: Lists all the available REST API operations.
Endpoint: Operations_List
API: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
instruction_candidates.back_trans_input:
Your task involves a reverse-engineering process where you will analyze a user query to infer specific details about an API endpoint. Based on the given user query, you are expected to:

1. **Identify the Endpoint's Identifier:** Derive the endpoint identifier that aligns with the functionality implied by the user query.
2. **Determine Endpoint Functionality:** Interpret the user query to understand and describe the functionality of the endpoint.
3. **Describe the Endpoint:** Provide a detailed description of the endpoint based on the needs and context presented in the user query.
4. **Specify the API Name:** Identify and state the name of the API to which this endpoint belongs, as suggested by the user query.

Your response should clearly articulate these four elements (identifier, functionality, description, API name) in a manner that reflects an accurate understanding of the user query. Consider the query as a real-world scenario or problem that the endpoint is designed to address.

Examples for practice:

###Input:
Please give me an example of how to use the endpoint WebServices_CreateOrUpdate from Azure ML Web Services Management Client.
###Output:
Functionality: 
Description: Create or update a web service. This call will overwrite an existing web service. Note that there is no warning or confirmation. This is a nonrecoverable operation. If your intent is to create a new web service, call the Get operation first to verify that it does not exist.
Endpoint: WebServices_CreateOrUpdate
API: Azure ML Web Services Management Client

###Input:
Please give me an example of how to use the endpoint WebServices_CreateRegionalProperties from Azure ML Web Services Management Client.
###Output:
Functionality: 
Description: Creates an encrypted credentials parameter blob for the specified region. To get the web service from a region other than the region in which it has been created, you must first call Create Regional Web Services Properties to create a copy of the encrypted credential parameter blob in that region. You only need to do this before the first time that you get the web service in the new region.
Endpoint: WebServices_CreateRegionalProperties
API: Azure ML Web Services Management Client

###Input:
I need to get the web service definition as specified by a subscription, resource group, and name with the Azure ML Web Services Management Client. Please help me with that.
###Output:
Functionality: 
Description: Gets the Web Service Definition as specified by a subscription, resource group, and name. Note that the storage credentials and web service keys are not returned by this call. To get the web service access keys, call List Keys.
Endpoint: WebServices_Get
API: Azure ML Web Services Management Client

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to know which REST API operations are available to use with Azure ML Web Services Management Client. Can you help me list them all using the Operations_List endpoint?

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://management.azure.comundefined/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/operations?api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}
api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Lists all the available REST API operations.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to know which REST API operations are currently available with Azure ML Web Services Management Client. Could you help me by using the Operations_List endpoint?

api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Lists all the available REST API operations.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices?%24skiptoken=SOME_STRING_VALUE&api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to retrieve a list of all web services in my Current Subscription using Azure ML Web Services Management Client. Could you please guide me on how to do that using the WebServices_ListBySubscriptionId endpoint?

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices?%24skiptoken=SOME_STRING_VALUE&api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body
api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Gets the web services in the specified subscription.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

  • Create or update a web service

api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices?%24skiptoken=SOME_STRING_VALUE&api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

best_instruction.candidate: I want to retrieve the list of web services that exist in a specific resource group using the Azure ML Web Services Management Client. Could you provide an example query for the endpoint "WebServices_ListByResourceGroup"?

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices?%24skiptoken=SOME_STRING_VALUE&api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body
api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Gets the web services in the specified resource group.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

$curl = curl_init();

  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);

} else {

}
api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Gets the web services in the specified resource group.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to delete a specific Azure ML web service using the Azure ML Web Services Management Client. How can I effectively use the endpoint WebServices_Remove to accomplish this task?

api_call:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("management.azure.comundefined")

conn.request("DELETE", "/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D?api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))
api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Deletes the specified web service.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

package main

import (

	"net/http"

)

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("DELETE", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to delete a particular web service using the Azure ML Web Services Management Client. How do I use the WebServices_Remove endpoint to accomplish this?

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D?api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Delete.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D?api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",

  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "DELETE",
]);

} else {

}

api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

1. **API Name Integration:** Clearly include the API's name in your query to ensure relevance.
2. **Specificity:** Replace broad or vague terms with precise, concrete details relevant to the API's purpose.
3. **Conciseness:** Keep your query as brief as possible while still fully conveying the needed information. Avoid unnecessary verbosity.
4. **Excluding API Endpoint:** Do not include the API's endpoint in your query; focus only on the user's need and how the API fulfills it.

Create a query that a user might realistically use when interacting with the given API. Think about typical scenarios or problems that the API is designed to solve and formulate your query accordingly.

Examples for practice:
###Input:
Functionality: 
Description: Gets the Web Service Definition as specified by a subscription, resource group, and name. Note that the storage credentials and web service keys are not returned by this call. To get the web service access keys, call List Keys.
Endpoint: WebServices_Get
API: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
###Output:
I need to get the web service definition as specified by a subscription, resource group, and name with the Azure ML Web Services Management Client. Please help me with that.

###Input:
Functionality: 
Description: Gets the Web Service Definition as specified by a subscription, resource group, and name. Note that the storage credentials and web service keys are not returned by this call. To get the web service access keys, call List Keys.
Endpoint: WebServices_Get
API: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
###Output:
Please give me an example of how to use the endpoint WebServices_Get from Azure ML Web Services Management Client.

###Input:
Functionality: 
Description: Creates an encrypted credentials parameter blob for the specified region. To get the web service from a region other than the region in which it has been created, you must first call Create Regional Web Services Properties to create a copy of the encrypted credential parameter blob in that region. You only need to do this before the first time that you get the web service in the new region.
Endpoint: WebServices_CreateRegionalProperties
API: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
###Output:
Please give me an example of how to use the endpoint WebServices_CreateRegionalProperties from Azure ML Web Services Management Client.

Remember, the goal is to demonstrate how a user would benefit from this specific API in a realistic scenario, using precise and clear language. Here is the actual task for you:

###Input:

Endpoint: WebServices_Remove

###Output:

api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Deletes the specified web service.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Gets the Web Service Definition as specified by a subscription, resource group, and name. Note that the storage credentials and web service keys are not returned by this call. To get the web service access keys, call List Keys.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("management.azure.comundefined")

conn.request("GET", "/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D?region=SOME_STRING_VALUE&api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

Please help me construct a query with this API to get the details for a given subscription, resource group, and name without returning storage credentials or web service keys.

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D?region=SOME_STRING_VALUE&api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}
api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Gets the Web Service Definition as specified by a subscription, resource group, and name. Note that the storage credentials and web service keys are not returned by this call. To get the web service access keys, call List Keys.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D?region=SOME_STRING_VALUE&api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Modifies an existing web service resource. The PATCH API call is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether it has completed successfully, you must perform a Get operation.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D?api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"properties\":{\"assets\":{\"property1\":{\"id\":\"string\",\"inputPorts\":{\"property1\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"},\"property2\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"}},\"locationInfo\":{\"credentials\":\"string\",\"uri\":\"string\"},\"metadata\":{\"property1\":\"string\",\"property2\":\"string\"},\"name\":\"string\",\"outputPorts\":{\"property1\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"},\"property2\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"}},\"parameters\":[{\"modeValuesInfo\":{\"property1\":{\"interfaceString\":\"string\",\"parameters\":[{}]},\"property2\":{\"interfaceString\":\"string\",\"parameters\":[{}]}},\"name\":\"string\",\"parameterType\":\"string\"}],\"type\":\"Module\"},\"property2\":{\"id\":\"string\",\"inputPorts\":{\"property1\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"},\"property2\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"}},\"locationInfo\":{\"credentials\":\"string\",\"uri\":\"string\"},\"metadata\":{\"property1\":\"string\",\"property2\":\"string\"},\"name\":\"string\",\"outputPorts\":{\"property1\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"},\"property2\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"}},\"parameters\":[{\"modeValuesInfo\":{\"property1\":{\"interfaceString\":\"string\",\"parameters\":[{}]},\"property2\":{\"interfaceString\":\"string\",\"parameters\":[{}]}},\"name\":\"string\",\"parameterType\":\"string\"}],\"type\":\"Module\"}},\"commitmentPlan\":{\"id\":\"string\"},\"description\":\"string\",\"diagnostics\":{\"expiry\":\"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z\",\"level\":\"None\"},\"exampleRequest\":{\"globalParameters\":{\"property1\":{},\"property2\":{}},\"inputs\":{\"property1\":[[{}]],\"property2\":[[{}]]}},\"exposeSampleData\":true,\"input\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"format\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true},\"property2\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"},\"property2\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"format\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true},\"property2\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"},\"keys\":{\"primary\":\"string\",\"secondary\":\"string\"},\"machineLearningWorkspace\":{\"id\":\"string\"},\"output\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"format\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true},\"property2\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"},\"property2\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"format\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true},\"property2\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"},\"packageType\":\"Graph\",\"parameters\":{\"property1\":{\"certificateThumbprint\":\"string\",\"value\":{}},\"property2\":{\"certificateThumbprint\":\"string\",\"value\":{}}},\"payloadsInBlobStorage\":true,\"payloadsLocation\":{\"credentials\":\"string\",\"uri\":\"string\"},\"readOnly\":true,\"realtimeConfiguration\":{\"maxConcurrentCalls\":4},\"storageAccount\":{\"key\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\"},\"title\":\"string\"},\"tags\":{\"property1\":\"string\",\"property2\":\"string\"}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("PATCH", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}
api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Modifies an existing web service resource. The PATCH API call is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether it has completed successfully, you must perform a Get operation.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

description: Modifies an existing web service resource. The PATCH API call is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether it has completed successfully, you must perform a Get operation.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Modifies an existing web service resource. The PATCH API call is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether it has completed successfully, you must perform a Get operation.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Modifies an existing web service resource. The PATCH API call is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether it has completed successfully, you must perform a Get operation.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D?api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Put.new(url)
request["content-type"] = 'application/json'
request.body = "{\"properties\":{\"assets\":{\"property1\":{\"id\":\"string\",\"inputPorts\":{\"property1\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"},\"property2\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"}},\"locationInfo\":{\"credentials\":\"string\",\"uri\":\"string\"},\"metadata\":{\"property1\":\"string\",\"property2\":\"string\"},\"name\":\"string\",\"outputPorts\":{\"property1\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"},\"property2\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"}},\"parameters\":[{\"modeValuesInfo\":{\"property1\":{\"interfaceString\":\"string\",\"parameters\":[{}]},\"property2\":{\"interfaceString\":\"string\",\"parameters\":[{}]}},\"name\":\"string\",\"parameterType\":\"string\"}],\"type\":\"Module\"},\"property2\":{\"id\":\"string\",\"inputPorts\":{\"property1\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"},\"property2\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"}},\"locationInfo\":{\"credentials\":\"string\",\"uri\":\"string\"},\"metadata\":{\"property1\":\"string\",\"property2\":\"string\"},\"name\":\"string\",\"outputPorts\":{\"property1\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"},\"property2\":{\"type\":\"Dataset\"}},\"parameters\":[{\"modeValuesInfo\":{\"property1\":{\"interfaceString\":\"string\",\"parameters\":[{}]},\"property2\":{\"interfaceString\":\"string\",\"parameters\":[{}]}},\"name\":\"string\",\"parameterType\":\"string\"}],\"type\":\"Module\"}},\"commitmentPlan\":{\"id\":\"string\"},\"description\":\"string\",\"diagnostics\":{\"expiry\":\"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z\",\"level\":\"None\"},\"exampleRequest\":{\"globalParameters\":{\"property1\":{},\"property2\":{}},\"inputs\":{\"property1\":[[{}]],\"property2\":[[{}]]}},\"exposeSampleData\":true,\"input\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"format\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true},\"property2\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"},\"property2\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"format\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true},\"property2\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"},\"keys\":{\"primary\":\"string\",\"secondary\":\"string\"},\"machineLearningWorkspace\":{\"id\":\"string\"},\"output\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"format\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true},\"property2\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"},\"property2\":{\"description\":\"string\",\"format\":\"string\",\"properties\":{\"property1\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true},\"property2\":{\"enum\":[{}],\"format\":\"Byte\",\"type\":\"Boolean\",\"x-ms-isnullable\":true,\"x-ms-isordered\":true}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"}},\"title\":\"string\",\"type\":\"object\"},\"packageType\":\"Graph\",\"parameters\":{\"property1\":{\"certificateThumbprint\":\"string\",\"value\":{}},\"property2\":{\"certificateThumbprint\":\"string\",\"value\":{}}},\"payloadsInBlobStorage\":true,\"payloadsLocation\":{\"credentials\":\"string\",\"uri\":\"string\"},\"readOnly\":true,\"realtimeConfiguration\":{\"maxConcurrentCalls\":4},\"storageAccount\":{\"key\":\"string\",\"name\":\"string\"},\"title\":\"string\"},\"location\":\"string\",\"tags\":{\"property1\":\"string\",\"property2\":\"string\"}}"

api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Create or update a web service. This call will overwrite an existing web service. Note that there is no warning or confirmation. This is a nonrecoverable operation. If your intent is to create a new web service, call the Get operation first to verify that it does not exist.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Create or update a web service. This call will overwrite an existing web service. Note that there is no warning or confirmation. This is a nonrecoverable operation. If your intent is to create a new web service, call the Get operation first to verify that it does not exist.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Create or update a web service. This call will overwrite an existing web service. Note that there is no warning or confirmation. This is a nonrecoverable operation. If your intent is to create a new web service, call the Get operation first to verify that it does not exist.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

api_call:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("management.azure.comundefined")

conn.request("POST", "/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D/CreateRegionalBlob?region=SOME_STRING_VALUE&api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D/CreateRegionalBlob?region=SOME_STRING_VALUE&api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

description: Creates an encrypted credentials parameter blob for the specified region. api_call:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("management.azure.comundefined")

conn.request("GET", "/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D/listKeys?api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

best_instruction.candidate: I want to retrieve the access keys for a specific web service using Azure ML Web Services Management Client. Can you please provide guidance on how to make the WebServices_ListKeys API call to get the desired keys?

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D/listKeys?api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}
api_name: Azure ML Web Services Management Client
description: Gets the access keys for the specified web service.
api_description:
These APIs allow end users to operate on Azure Machine Learning Web Services resources. They support the following operations:
  • Create or update a web service
  • Get a web service
  • Patch a web service
  • Delete a web service
  • Get All Web Services in a Resource Group
  • Get All Web Services in a Subscription
  • Get Web Services Keys

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://management.azure.comundefined/subscriptions/%7BsubscriptionId%7D/resourceGroups/%7BresourceGroupName%7D/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearning/webServices/%7BwebServiceName%7D/listKeys?api-version=SOME_STRING_VALUE",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}
